quest.name: Far from Free
journal: The Ala Mhigan delegate to Radz-at-Han has grim news to convey.

You learn from the allied delegates appointed to Sundrop that a blasphemy has made a sudden appearance in the streets of Ala Mhigo. With the city guard's ranks left severely depleted and most of their healers committed to treating the tempered, Raubahn has requested that you assist in efforts to slay the beast.

After arriving in Ala Mhigo, Raubahn explains that a young man was seen transforming into a blasphemy, and that only the swift response of the city guard prevented certain catastrophe. While they succeeded in shepherding the bystanders to safety, they were unable to bring down the creature, which remains at large. With next to no information on the blasphemy's identity or its whereabouts, Raubahn suggests that the two of you investigate reports of a similar incident that occurred just moments ago in Ala Gannha.

On the outskirts of Ala Gannha, you happen upon the aftermath of a battle with several beasts, including two soldiers in need of your ministrations. With no obvious danger in the immediate vicinity, you rush to their aid, while Raubahn scouts the area for any creatures that may have escaped.

The pair of battle-worn soldiers are grateful for your help, but while their physical injuries have been dealt with, even your most potent magicks cannot expunge the memory of the horrific scenes they have witnessed. As agreed, you head to the village to meet with Raubahn.

You find Raubahn in conversation with Raganfrid, the village elder, and Arenvald. As Raganfrid explains, the events surrounding the summoning of Sri Lakshmi and Fordola's intervention had a profound effect on him, and after much soul-searching, he formed the Silver Griffins, of which Arenvald is now a member. Their objective is to oversee the reintegration of returning Ala Mhigan refugees and other groups that remain on the fringes of society, such as those branded as traitors for siding with the Garlean Empire during the occupation. However, the surviving relatives of the Crania Lupi have refused all attempts to assist them, and it is believed that the people who transformed into beasts belonged to this selfsame group. With despair being the driving force behind the metamorphosis, Raganfrid and Arenvald have vowed to address the root causes and thereby avert any further tragedies, and upon hearing this, Raubahn pledges his full support for the Silver Griffins. For the time being, he bids that you return to the city to discuss a plan of action.

Over the course of his troubled life, Raubahn has felt despair time and time again, and memories of the bloody banquet still haunt him to this day. As such, he understands perhaps better than most the importance of the Silver Griffins and their efforts to unite Ala Mhigo. Although there is little that can be done at present to assist them or those tracking the blasphemy and other beasts, he asks that you await further instructions.

※The next role quest will be available from the blasphemy hunter upon reaching level 86 in any healer class.
objectives: Speak with the blasphemy hunter in the Ala Mhigan Quarter.
Speak with Raubahn outside Ala Gannha.
Speak with Raubahn in the Ala Mhigan Quarter.

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGOMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: If you are ready to lend us your aid, I'll apprise you of the situation.

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGOMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: We've received reports of a creature believed to be a blasphemy stalking the streets of Ala Mhigo. Troops have been assigned to track and slay the beast, but there are likely to be casualties.

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGOMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: With most of our healers posted elsewhere, we had thought to petition you for aid...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I would be glad to help.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Sounds like you need better soldiers, not more healers, but if I must...

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGOMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: Once again, we're in your debt. We shall inform Commander Aldynn forthwith.

dialogue.name: ULDAHMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: My comrades in the Immortal Flames will be glad to have you watching over them!

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGOMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: Hah, well, no man or woman alive could hold a candle to the Warrior of Light─but in any case, we're stretched rather thin at present. Given that we know precious little of our foe, we'd sooner turn to the best of the best now than wait until the need is undeniable.

dialogue.name: ULDAHMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: No doubt my Ul'dahn comrades will be heartened to have you fighting alongside them.

dialogue.name: ULDAHMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: You see, as there've been no sightings of any blasphemies in our lands, we have joined our Ala Mhigan allies in their hunt for the fiend.

dialogue.name: ULDAHMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: Trouble is, the majority of our own healers are working day and night to treat the tempered imperials captured at Paglth'an.

dialogue.name: ULDAHMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: For that reason, we too will be glad of your help. Aye, your presence alone will be of great comfort to the troops. I'm sure.

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGOMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: As time is of the essence, I ask that you make your way to the Ala Mhigan Quarter and report for duty. Commander Aldynn is overseeing the hunt, and he will explain all upon your arrival. May Rhalgr grant you strength.

dialogue.name: ULDAHMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: As I live and breathe, it's the great Forename Surname! I'd love to bombard you with questions about your exploits, but my associate here would like a word with you first.

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGOMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: When you get to Ala Mhigo, head to the square outside the palace. One of the soldiers stationed there will explain the rest.

dialogue.name: ULDAHMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: The sultana wasted no time in extending the support of the Flames to Ala Mhigo when the blasphemy first reared its head─and it's a good thing she did!

dialogue.name: LIVERATIONARMY
dialogue.text: Ah, MistressMaster Surname. We were told you were on your way, but this is even quicker than expected.

dialogue.name: LIVERATIONARMY
dialogue.text: I'll tell Commander Aldynn you've arrived. One moment, please.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: (-Raubahn-)Glad you could join us.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I appreciate that we've a far greater crisis to worry about, but we cannot afford to ignore the situation here either.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Now that the far greater crisis has been resolved, we may─and must─turn our undivided attention to matters of a smaller but no less deadly scale.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Aye─I'd like nothing more than to hear about your recent adventures, but I'm afraid such pleasantries will have to wait.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: As our man in Thavnair will have told you, a blasphemy is loose in Ala Mhigo.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: When it first appeared, the city guard were able to get most of the bystanders to safety, and for a mercy, those caught in the chaos only suffered minor injuries.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: But the fiend managed to escape and has not been seen since. We must find it, and soon, for as long as it remains at large, every man, woman, and child is at risk.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: As was the case in Thavnair, the blasphemy's very existence seems to spur the creation of lesser beasts. The longer it is allowed to roam free, the more tragedy our people will suffer.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Are you certain it's a blasphemy?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Did anyone see the change take place?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Aye, there were several eyewitnesses who gave the same account. A man walking through the Ala Mhigan Quarter fell to his knees all of a sudden, and a moment later transformed into the monstrosity we now pursue.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: But beyond the fact he was a young Highlander, we know next to nothing about him. Even the descriptions of his appearance are too vague to help identify the lad, and we've no clues as to his name or background.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: For all we know he might not have even been born in Ala Mhigo─might've been the son of refugees come to visit. There are other possibilities we're investigating, though...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: That said, I doubt his circumstances are unique. Blasphemies and beasts are born when men are overcome by despair, and whatever drove him to turn likely could've done the same to another.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Therefore, if we are to prevent future tragedies, it is imperative that we identify and address the underlying cause. Until we do, we'll have no choice but to deal with the afflicted the only way we know how: by granting them a quick death.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: For now, I would have you join the hunt and keep my men from falling prey to these creatures. Are you up to it?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: You have my thanks.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: And as chance would have it, we've just received word that a number of beasts were spotted on the outskirts of Ala Gannha.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: The troops stationed there have already put them down, but were wounded in the process. First and foremost, they need medical attention, and that's where you come in. I'll meet you there.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Although the soldiers were able to lead the beasts away from the village and cull the lot of them, victory did not come easily.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: It's times like these that our lack of healers is most sorely felt. I daresay they've yet to receive any treatment at all. See to their wounds while I survey the area for any stragglers that may have escaped.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Once I've completed my patrol, I'll head to the village to gather eyewitness reports. Look for me there after.

dialogue.name: INJUREDSOLDIERA
dialogue.text: Ugh... It's my own damn fault for being so careless! What must Commander Aldynn think of me?

dialogue.name: INJUREDSOLDIERB
dialogue.text: Knowing what they are...who they were... Could any of us end up like that?

dialogue.name: INJUREDSOLDIERA
dialogue.text: Gods be good! I feel reborn!

dialogue.name: INJUREDSOLDIERA
dialogue.text: Hold on... You're Forename, aren't you? I can't believe it! You're the one who inspired me to join the Resistance in the first place, and now you've come to save me in my hour of need. I'll never forget this! Thank you, thank you!

dialogue.name: INJUREDSOLDIERB
dialogue.text: I saw them change. Right before my eyes. Those weren't monsters I killed, but innocent men...

dialogue.name: INJUREDSOLDIERB
dialogue.text: But it had to be done. There were others we had to protect. And thanks to you, I can continue to do just that. Once I've made my way back, I'll give a full account. The families, they'll...they'll understand...

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: It was good of you to come all this way─though I never doubted for a moment that you wouldn't.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: After all you've done for the people of Gyr Abania, we couldn't ask for more. And yet, here you are.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: For treating the wounds of those soldiers, you have my thanks─and theirs too, no doubt. It seems they were indeed successful in slaying all the beasts, if my search is any indication, but we must remain vigilant.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I've also spoken with several people who witnessed the moment of the transformation, though the ordeal has understandably left them rather shaken.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: I hear you've been through a fair few ordeals yourself, Forename.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: As for me, I've been kept busy with this and that, like getting the hang of this wheelchair. Obviously, it has its limitations, but it gets me where I need to go.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: I've been working with this new organization as well, which is what brought me here. But no sooner had I arrived than those locals turned...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Raganfrid, I heard you were there when it happened. What can you tell us?

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: The ones who underwent the change...are the very people we were trying to help.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: Perhaps I should explain from the beginning.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: The meeting Lyse held in the Royal Palace marked a turning point for all of Gyr Abania. It spurred us to open a dialogue with peoples and communities we otherwise would've shunned. But there're still so many problems to be addressed, and countless souls struggling to build new lives for themselves.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: I decided to form a volunteer group─the Silver Griffins. Our main concern is the welfare of Ala Mhigans who sided with the Empire─for whatever reason─and helping them find their place in society. In particular, the surviving families of the Crania Lupi.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: But I thought you despised the Skulls!

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: You've changed your tune.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: Make no mistake─I've not forgiven them. I don't have that in me, and I doubt I ever will. But the memory of that day in the palace, of Fordola asking to be locked up again after saving us all...it stayed with me.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: Got me to thinking about why she and the other youths would commit such atrocities. Why they'd swear to serve the Empire. And the answer was simple: because they'd seen what we'd seen and suffered much the same.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: In a hell where all were condemned, they chose to betray one brother to save another. That's how the Garleans win─not by breaking you, but by making you break yourself. By making that choice the right one for a man at the end of his tether.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: Healing only begins with liberation─and some scars never will regardless. Those who've returned from foreign lands may have difficulty carving out a living here, but the ones who'd pledged allegiance to Garlemald...

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: This is not the Ala Mhigo we dreamed of. But after twenty years of misery, I'll not see it all thrown away because we can't come to terms with the past. That's why I formed the Silver Griffins. To see that no one is cast aside.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: It's a cause I support, and it's what brought me here today. I've been acting as a mediator.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: Aye, and in the short time he's been with us, he's proven himself a natural. But despite our early successes, the families of the Skulls continue to refuse our help.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I think I see where this is leading. They're the ones who turned, yes?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: It comes as no surprise. Their kin tormented and murdered fellow Ala Mhigans. Anyone with a conscience would feel shame and guilt, and for some, it might be too much to bear.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Hmm... I think I might know why they're turning us away. It's a sensitive matter, though, so let's go somewhere we won't be overheard.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: It's about one of the men who turned. I saw his memories.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: With the Echo... I'll not pretend I understand it, but tell us what you learned.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: I only caught a glimpse, but that was enough...

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: It was during the occupation. A man raising his son. Only the two of them, but they were a family. To keep his boy clothed and fed, he chose to side with the Empire. He knew what others would say, but he did it anyway.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: And so he was branded a traitor. Every day, his son listened to the jeering, the insults, but there was nothing he could do. When he came of age, he joined the Skulls in the hope it would make life easier for his father. He never dared to question his orders, no matter how depraved.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: He died in the revolution, but not before killing his own countrymen. His father wept not for the betrayer and murderer, but for the man he could've been. He blamed it all on himself, right up until the change took him.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I can only pray he and his boy have finally found the peace they were denied in life. Alas, theirs is an all-too-familiar tale. They cannot forgive themselves, nor can they see how anyone else could.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: The sins of their kin weigh heavy on them. They think themselves undeserving of our compassion.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: If they carry on like that, they'll turn into beasts. We've got to help them before it's too late.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Growing up half-Garlean in Ala Mhigo, I know how it feels to be shunned and hated. To hate myself.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: But so long as we give ourselves and others a chance, we can change for the better. And while I might not be as clever or eloquent as someone like Alphinaud, I know I can make a difference.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Aye, I might not be quite the swordsman I used to be, but I'm still a fighter at heart. And I owe it to A'aba and Aulie to make the most of this life so long as I've got it.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: We Silver Griffins will give our all to see that no more beasts or blasphemies ravage Gyr Abania again. So, Commander Aldynn, do we have your approval to continue our work?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Of course. There's no enemy more formidable than despair, and I'd be a fool to refuse your help.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: That even a single one of our people has succumbed to this transformation is proof of our failure to protect them.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Therefore, I pledge the Silver Griffins my unconditional support. Together, we will prevail.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Now that we have Forename on hand to aid the troops, I believe we are ready to face any beasts we encounter.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Though I fear it is only a matter of time before others appear, I ask that you lend the Silver Griffins your assistance in the meantime.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Very good. For now, let's return to the city.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Those who harbor guilt do so not because they are weak of heart, but because they have failed to meet the demands they make of themselves.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: 'Twas the same for me when I believed that my failures had led to the sultana's assassination. The despair and self-loathing were...indescribable.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I was fortunate that you and the other Scions came to my rescue. That I had friends who convinced me I was more than the sum of my worst mistakes.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Now we must do the same for the people of Ala Mhigo. We must help them to heal and find the strength to...if not forgive, then come to terms with who we were, so that we can look to who we can be. Who we should aspire to be.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: This is precisely why the work of the Silver Griffins is so vital. Though our problems are not new, the emergence of this deadly phenomenon means we cannot afford to delay addressing them any longer. And we will be better for it, ultimately.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Once we've decided a course of action, you'll be the first to know. Until then, may Rhalgr watch over and keep you.

dialogue.name: LIVERATIONARMY
dialogue.text: With you on our side, those beasts are no match for us!
